titles.title: I Heard the Bells on Christmas Day

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: I heard the bells on Christmas day Their old familiar carols play, And wild and sweet the words repeat Of peace of earth, goodwill to men.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I thought how, as the day had come, The belfries of all Christendom Had rolled along th'unbroken song Of peace on earth, goodwill to men.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: And in despair I bowed my head: "There is no peace on earth," I said, "For hate is strong, and mocks the song Of peace on earth, goodwill to men."

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Then pealed the bells more loud and deep: "God is not dead: nor doth He sleep; The wrong shall fail, the right prevail, With peace on earth, goodwill to men."

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Till, ringing, singing on its way, The world revolved from night to day, A voice, a chime, a chant sublime, Of peace on earth, goodwill to men!
